definition: to dry over a fire/to bake
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
pooh/pah/bah/(today used as a phonetic component in 部[bu4], 倍[bei4], 培[pei2], 剖[pou1] etc)
to cure by drying over a fire (tea, meat etc)/to bake
to dry over a fire/to roast
variant of 貝果|贝果[bei4 guo3]
to dry and roast over a low fire (tea, chestnuts, seaweed etc)/to torrefy

sentences.english: In the past, bread was only sold in loaves in baked good stores.
sentences.chinese: 以前，麪包都是在烤焙房裏一整條賣的。

sentences.english: Cause when baked fried grouper fry, and will produce bitterness and astringency.
sentences.chinese: 會造成煎焙時有煎斑，且會產生苦味及澀味。

sentences.english: Ground-nuts, not roasted or otherwise cooked, whether or not shelled or broken.
sentences.chinese: 未焙炒或未烹煮的花生，不論是否去殼或破碎。

sentences.english: Besides roasts, Greek cooking features creative casseroles.
sentences.chinese: 希臘烹調除了烤制外，有特色的是焙盤菜。

sentences.english: Air permeability of fabrics increased slightly after curing process.
sentences.chinese: 焙烘後織物的透氣性均比焙烘前有所增加。

sentences.english: Air permeability of fabrics increased slightly after curing process.
sentences.chinese: 焙烘後織物的透氣性均比焙烘前有所增加。

sentences.english: Rice roasting process is a novel technique for raw starch gelatinization.
sentences.chinese: 焙炒是一種全新的使原料澱粉糊化的方法。

definition: to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast
cooking method/to boil sb alive (capital punishment in imperial China)
to dry over a fire/to roast
phonetic character used in loanwords for the sound "jia", although 夹 is more common
